name: Malwina Luczak
content:
Malwina J. Luczak is a mathematician specializing in probability theory and the theory of random graphs. She is Professor of Applied Probability and ARC Future Fellow in the University of Melbourne.[1]
 Luczak grew up in Poland, and began her university studies at age 16 at the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń, studying the philology of the English language. However, after a second year studying philology at Keele University in the UK, she decided to switch to mathematics, and enrolled at St Catherine's College, Oxford. After her first year's examinations, she was able to obtain scholarship support and continue her studies and remain at Oxford for doctoral work.[2] She completed her D.Phil. in 2001 with a dissertation, Probability, algorithms and telecommunication systems, supervised by Colin McDiarmid and Dominic Welsh.[3]
 She became an assistant lecturer at the Statistical Laboratory at the University of Cambridge and then a reader in mathematics at the London School of Economics. However, in 2010, failing to receive an expected promotion to professor, she took instead a professorial chair at the University of Sheffield and a five-year Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council Leadership Fellowship. She moved again to Queen Mary University of London before taking her present position in Melbourne in 2017.[2]
 Luczak's publications include research on the supermarket model in queueing theory,[a]
cores of random graphs,[b] the giant component in random graphs with specified degree distributions,[c] and the Glauber dynamics of the Ising model.[d]
 They include:[4]

raw:
Polish-Australian mathematicianMalwina J. LuczakBornPolandAlma materNicolaus Copernicus University in ToruńKeele UniversitySt Catherine's College, OxfordOccupationUniversity of Melbourne (professor)
Malwina J. Luczak is a mathematician specializing in probability theory and the theory of random graphs. She is Professor of Applied Probability and ARC Future Fellow in the University of Melbourne.[1]

Contents

1 Education and research
2 Research
3 References
4 External links


Education and research[edit]
Luczak grew up in Poland, and began her university studies at age 16 at the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń, studying the philology of the English language. However, after a second year studying philology at Keele University in the UK, she decided to switch to mathematics, and enrolled at St Catherine's College, Oxford. After her first year's examinations, she was able to obtain scholarship support and continue her studies and remain at Oxford for doctoral work.[2] She completed her D.Phil. in 2001 with a dissertation, Probability, algorithms and telecommunication systems, supervised by Colin McDiarmid and Dominic Welsh.[3]
She became an assistant lecturer at the Statistical Laboratory at the University of Cambridge and then a reader in mathematics at the London School of Economics. However, in 2010, failing to receive an expected promotion to professor, she took instead a professorial chair at the University of Sheffield and a five-year Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council Leadership Fellowship. She moved again to Queen Mary University of London before taking her present position in Melbourne in 2017.[2]

Research[edit]
Luczak's publications include research on the supermarket model in queueing theory,[a]
cores of random graphs,[b] the giant component in random graphs with specified degree distributions,[c] and the Glauber dynamics of the Ising model.[d]
They include:[4]



a.
Luczak, Malwina J.; McDiarmid, Colin (2006), "On the maximum queue length in the supermarket model", Annals of Probability, 34 (2): 493–527, arXiv:math/0605639, Bibcode:2006math......5639L, doi:10.1214/00911790500000710, MR 2223949



b.
Janson, Svante; Luczak, Malwina J. (2007), "A simple solution to the k-core problem", Random Structures & Algorithms, 30 (1–2): 50–62, doi:10.1002/rsa.20147, MR 2283221, S2CID 17471505



c.
Janson, Svante; Luczak, Malwina J. (2009), "A new approach to the giant component problem", Random Structures & Algorithms, 34 (2): 197–216, doi:10.1002/rsa.20231, MR 2490288, S2CID 7261361



d.
Levin, David A.; Luczak, Malwina J.; Peres, Yuval (2010), "Glauber dynamics for the mean-field Ising model: cut-off, critical power law, and metastability", Probability Theory and Related Fields, 146 (1–2): 223–265, arXiv:0712.0790, doi:10.1007/s00440-008-0189-z, MR 2550363, S2CID 7406436
